utils module¶

Created on Wed Oct 23 14:42:48 2019

@author: maximevono

class pygauss.utils.Chebyshev(a, b, n, func)[source]¶

This class computes a Chebyshev approximation of a given function.

__init__(a, b, n, func)[source]¶
Parameters

  • a (float) – Lower bound of the interval [a,b] on which the function is approximated.

  • b (float) – Upper bound of the interval [a,b] on which the function is approximated.

  • n (int) – Degree of the polynomial approximation.

  • func (function) – Function to be approximated.

eval(x)[source]¶
Parameters

x (float) – Point at which the approximation has to be computed.

Returns

Return type

The value of the approximation at x.

pygauss.utils.col_vector_norms(a, order=None)[source]¶
pygauss.utils.CG(A, b, x=None, K=None, tol=None, info=False)[source]¶
pygauss.utils.diagonal_form(A, lower=0, upper=0)[source]¶

A is a numpy square matrix this function converts a square matrix to diagonal ordered form returned matrix in ab shape which can be used directly for scipy.linalg.solve_banded

pygauss.utils.triangular_inversion(triang_arg)[source]¶

Counts inversion of a triangular matrix (lower or upper).

Parameters

triang_arg (np.matrix, np.array) – triangular matrix for inversion

Returns

inverse of triangular matrix

Return type

np.matrix

Raises

  • Exception – An error occured while passing non-square matrix

  • Exception – An error occured while passing non-triangular matrix

  • Exception – An error occured while passing singular matrix
